node.statement: Local vertex smoothing via Lagrangian surgery: Each vertex singularity admits a local Lagrangian smoothing supported in an arbitrarily small ball B_delta(v). For Type B vertices (two transverse Lagrangian planes), apply Polterovich-Lalonde-Sikorav surgery: the neck H_lambda = {(z_1,z_2) in C^2 : Im(z_1 bar{z_2})=0, |z_1|^2-|z_2|^2=lambda} is a smooth Lagrangian converging to L_1 union L_2 as lambda->0. For Type A vertices (4 distinct planes), apply tropical resolution: split the 4-valent configuration into two 3-valent configurations connected by an edge, then smooth each using the Matessi-Mikhalkin Lagrangian pair-of-pants construction. In both cases the surgery is generated by a compactly supported Hamiltonian.
